text: San Marino at the Olympics is a history of 21 games in 16 countries and 80+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), San Marino ; retrieved 2012-10-13. Since 1960, San Marino has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement".Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-10-13. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for San Marino was SMA. It is now SMR."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 91 [PDF p. 92 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-14. ==History== A team from San Marino was first at the 1960 Summer Olympics. They have been in 12 Summer Olympics and 7 Winter Olympics. The country has never won a medal.San Marino at the Olympics , The Telegraph Among its most successful athletes are Francesco Amici and Emanuela Felici. Both competed in shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics and "missed out on places in the finals by the narrowest of margins". ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites== * San Marino profile at London2012.com Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:Sport in San Marino
title: San Marino at the Olympics
